column4: okay, here's a REALLY good one, for anyone with postfix experience
my postfix program is set for local delivery after fetchmail sends all my POP3 mail there, but the postfix log is saying:
postfix: config variable inet_interfaces: host not found: 127.0.0.0/8
well its normally in there to begin with...
sorry for my ignorance, but where would loopback be enabled? as in, the lo interface?
I'm using transport_maps instead of relayhost
and ogra: thanks for the help; it turned out the interfaces were connected properly, but my /etc/postfix/transport wasn't
that was weird; I got all my messages back (twice) -- looks like they were spooled!
you need to patch the source
that's what I was worried about
I'm trying to help out a person set up PPTP, and I'm not sure if they need something called the 'MPPE' patch
and ogra: hopefully they don't need it; hopefully pptp-linux will be sufficient
